page.title: 19ARC QUARRY CHEDDAR
page.content: {The quarry}is the main source of industrial work in Cheddar. Over 75 people work there. It was founded in the early 1900's and has been working ever since. The stone in Cheddar is made up of {limestone with a bit of sandstone.}The limestone is blasted twice a day. Once at 1 p.m. and again at 5 p.m. It is then loaded into lorries and transported to{blast furnaces and {steel works}such as{Port Talbot}in {South Wales. A day's work starts at 7.a.m. and goes on till 5 p.m. Jobs at the quarry include office work, driving and blasting limestone. About 250 deliveries are made each day, that is around{3000 tons of limestone and {chipping stones.
